Special Collections

Special Collections consist of material that has been collected on a certain subject area. These materials are often printed material but can vary in the type of items entered into the collection depending on the collecting area.

Most of these collections can be found by searching through the Library Catalog.

Collecting Areas

History of Recordkeeping (also known as the Vault)


We have several major book collections that have been donated in part by patrons. These collections have been kept together as a whole to keep the integrity of the collection. We have several different Collections including:

History of Printing Collection: This collection includes most of our vault items and displays how man has advanced in writing and record keeping throughout history.

Mormon Collection: This is a collection of books relating to anything LDS,  from Sunstone Magazine to the Millenial Star to Wilford Woodruff journals to books written about the wives of the Prophets. There are many more, feel free to come in and ask about it.

Scripture Collection: This collection includes many Bibles of different times, versions, and languages along with Books of Mormon and Doctrine & Covenants.

Local History Collection: This collection features many local authors along with giving a history of the Rexburg area and the surrounding areas including, but not limited to, St. Anthony, Rigby, and Idaho Falls.

Campus Author Collection: This is an ongoing collection that features any book that was written by faculty or staff members on campus.

Hinckley Hymnal Collection: This collection was donated by Thomas Hinckley and includes a variety of Hymn books from many religions and time periods.

Education Collection: This collection displays a history of education and some of the different books used to teach throughout time.

Yellowstone Park Collection: This collection features books that were written about Yellowstone Park.

Book Collections
The easiest way to search our Book Collections is to search the Library Catalog. You can search right there on the homepage or, on the library catalog page you can,
1. Click the drop down menu labeled "books/bios"
2. Then click "advanced search".
3. You can then type in the desired topic.
4. On the right hand side there is a drop down menu that reads "Limit by", you can click on this and click "Special Collections", it is about 13 down the list and it will show you the books that we have here in Special Collections relating to that topic.
